resources.string: Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Heartgem
Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Cloak
Defeat {targetName}
Recover {itemName}
Recover {itemName}
Shadows Cast By A Final Salute
Defeat Captain Patricia to recover her Heartgem. Then retrieve her cloak of office from Slumbering Echoes. Talk to Watcher Sexton in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"Who were you expecting?"
I was hoping to see Captain Patricia, but I knew it would be too good to be true.\n\nShe was in charge of the rearguard at Cleaves Malice before the fort was overtaken.
"What happened?"

She betrayed us! By the time we realized what was happening, our friends and families had been Corrupted.\n\nWe need you to recover her Heartgem, and reclaim her cloak of office from her estate in Slumbering Echoes.

Patricia has become twisted with Corruption.\n\nShe is no longer the person who received that cloak upon becoming a captain, and we can't allow her to keep her Heartgem. Bring them both back to me… please.
Patricia's Heartgem…See Corruption swirling inside it? \n\nIt finally feels real. She's really gone. She was once a fine Soulwarden, and someone very dear to me.
"Sorry for your loss."

Thank you, but she knew the risks. We all do.\n\nWe Soulwardens sometimes forget that we are only protected against Corruption, we aren't immune to it. Patricia was overcome, and we all paid the price.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat Corrupted
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Malice Aforethought
Break the defenses of the Corrupted by attacking Cleaves Malice. Talk to Warden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"I'm glad to hear it."

I hope that one day this wretched war with the Corrupted will end!\n\nIt's really taking a toll on us. The sooner we break their defenses, the sooner we can all get back to what really matters in life.
"What do you think matters?"

Food, friends, family, life! Take your pick, they're all under threat! The Corrupted have cut off one of our major supply routes.\n\nWe need you to punch a hole in the guards' defenses at Cleaves Malice. Can you do that?
"Sure, anything else?"
The eager type, are you? I like that! Have you talked to Warden Sexton? He's also looking for someone to travel to Cleaves Malice. \n\nTwo birds, one stone, maybe?
Help us break through the defensive line at Cleaves Malice.\n\nOur forces have taken bad losses, and those of us left need food and medicine to keep up our strength.

You caused a real commotion at Cleaves Malice, {playerName}! A few of our Rangers were able to slip through and deliver the supplies we needed. \n\nIt’s not a permanent fix, but it means we can keep fighting tomorrow!
"Wish I could do more."
Wars take time to win. It may not seem like much to you, but for us, it's the difference between a hot dinner and a cold stomachache. That’s worth a lot to my people here. \n\nThanks again, friend.
Travel to {POITags} to slow down the Icefield workers
Defeat {targetName} Workers
Defeat {targetName}
Descent to Frosted Slumber
Slow the Corrupted by defeating Foreman Robertson and his Icefield workers. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What do you mean?"
We were expanding the village of Slumbering Echoes…that's where I'm from.\n\nWhen the Corrupted overran it, it was almost too easy for the Corrupted to come and take the lumber.
"Too bad about your village."
We need to stop the construction before it becomes impossible to break their defenses.\n\nForeman Robertson is the key there. Take him and his work crew out, and we'll finally have the edge we need.
We need you to defeat the Foreman and his work crew.\n\nOur best strategy is to keep them from expanding their construction.
Nicely done! War is just as much about swinging hammers as swinging blades. Now that you’ve taken out the Foreman, their defenses are vulnerable. We can exploit that.
"I hope your village can recover."
Thanks, me too. Still hoping to retire there someday with my family…what's left of it. \n\nJust gotta chase all the Corrupted out first.
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Stolen Supplies
Recover Supplies from chests
All That's Left Not Torn Asunder
Recover the Stolen Supplies from Sunderfort and deliver them to Soulwarden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost.
"Yes?"

string.comment: male referring to female (Captain Patricia), male referring to male (Warden Phan)
string.speaker: Watcher Sexton - Eastburn / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenSexton

resources.string: Right before Patricia’s betrayal, a shipment of our supplies was stolen by Corrupted and taken to Sunderfort. \n\nYou’ve been such a good distraction, they might not have had time to unload it yet.
"No one's gone after them yet?"
We had other things on our minds at the time. Everything happened so fast… \n\nWould you be willing to go to Sunderfort and recover the supplies if they’re still there?
Think of it! Dried fruit, or perhaps even dried fish... New weapons, more armor, fresh shot...!\n\nPlease, find whatever you can in Sunderfort! Anything extra would be helpful.
You were able to recover some of the supplies? That's a load off my mind. \n\nThe world might be ending, but at least we won't go hungry.
"Will you be okay?"
Someday, I think. Right now…I just have to take things one fight at a time. That’s how she would have wanted it. \n\nThanks for everything.
Travel to {POITags} to discover clues about Corrupted activity
Recover {itemName}
Search for Journal Entry
Facets of Light and Darkness
Recover Heartgems from the Valleyrend Corrupted in Sunderfort, and find clues about Corrupted activity in the area. Talk to Ranger Knatchbull in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What do you need?"
We paid a steep price in the battle for Sunderfort. Many of our friends fell, and Corruption still has them. \n\nI see them when I scout the fort: puppets with the faces of my comrades.
"That's rough."

So many Soulwarden puppets in one place means that they’re planning something. I’d like you to search the fort for clues. While you’re there, please lay my friends to rest and recover their Heartgems.
Aside from recovering those Heartgems, we need to find out what the Corrupted are doing at Sunderfort.\n\nThere has to be something keeping them there.
Yes, I recognize these Heartgems. I’ll give them to the Wardens for purification. \n\nAs for me, it’s enough to know that they’re no longer tools of the enemy. That’s the best I can do for them now.
"I also found this note."

This page you've found... this is written in whatever tongue the Corrupted share. I can’t read it, but I may know someone who can. Maybe we can learn something from all this. \n\nThank you, Soulwarden.
Travel to {POITags} to uncover the secret of Corrupted ore
Defeat {targetName} Workers
Recover {itemName}
Recover {itemName}
Transmuting Iron to Dust

Slow the Corrupted war effort by defeating the Molderpick workers at the Defiler Excavation, and uncover the secret of the Corrupted ore. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What is it now?"

The Molderpick Corrupted have captured the old iron mine to the west. We’re calling it ‘Defiler Excavation’ now. \n\nBut the weird part is, we got our hands on some of the ore they’re mining there, and it’s...
"It's what?"

It’s terrible. You can crush it in your fist, like dirt. The iron we used to mine there was perfectly usable; something weird is going on. \n\nGo to the Defiler Excavation and see what you can find out about this ore.
If that ore is iron, it's the worst iron I've ever seen.\n\nWe need to find out more about it, and why the Molderpick workers want it.
You're back! Strange, this ore seems perfectly fine. Strong, even.\n\nAnd you say you found these vials throughout the mines? I wonder what happens when I pour it on the ore…
"Let's find out."
Yes, just as we thought. Now it’s as weak as the rest. \n\nWhy would the Corrupted do this? Why would they need this shoddy iron dust? There must be something else we're missing.
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Defeat {targetName} Guardian
Extract Azoth from the fallen Ancient statues
Redefining Boundaries
Collect Azoth Infused items from Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps
"What do we need?"

Is this your first cleansing ritual? I envy you. Cleansing a Heartgem consumes azoth… a lot of it. But with all the Corruption here, there’s not enough ambient azoth to pull it off. \n\nWe’ll need to get creative.
"I can do creative."

That’s what I like to hear. \n\nWe can use azoth-infused items for the ritual. We’re running low on them - and everything else - but you may find what's needed in the remains of the fallen Ancient statues.
Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps all have what we need to purify the Heartgems.\n\nWatch out for the Ancient Guardians, they mean business.
Oh, my, impressive! You've manage to gather all the materials we need to purify the Heartgems.\n\nThose Guardians didn't give you too much trouble, did they?
"Nothing I couldn't handle."
That’s what I figured. You’re strong, {playerName}, in more ways than one. \n\nI hope that if I ever fall to Corruption, there will be someone like you around to do this ritual for me.
Travel to Tempest Lane
Travel to Braided Borough
Search for traces of Warden Sexton
Search for more traces of Warden Sexton
The Ties That Blind
Locate the missing Soulwarden Sexton, and report his whereabouts to Warden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"Sure, what do you need?"

string.comment: male referring to male (him = Liam), male referring to female (Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Warden Phan - Eastburn / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenPhan

resources.string: Can I just say again how much I love your can-do attitude? \n\nAnyway, Warden Sexton went to deliver a message to Cleave’s Point, and he hasn’t come back. It’s not like him. Could you go find him?
"Are you worried about him?"

Oh, not me. It’s Dimka. She’s devoted to him, and she’s been so worried. Won’t eat, won’t sleep… I’m more worried about her than him, to be honest. \n\nPlease, find Sexton and help me put Dimka’s mind at rest.
With the losses we've suffered, every person is vital.\n\nNot to mention Soulwarden Dimka would be crushed to hear something happened to Sexton.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: You have letters for me?\n\nOdd, I've never met you before and I think I would have remembered you.
"Not from me… I'm sorry."

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: Oh, James, no… how could this have… wait. These love letters are not addressed to me. They’re all addressed to Patricia. \n\nSo he really did love her… Spark, I feel like such a fool right now.
Recover {itemName}
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Breakaway Fort
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Acedia Bastion
For A Rainy Day
Recover the Secret Caches at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion. Talk to Soulwarden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"I'm really sorry about Sexton."

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: Please, don’t. You mean well, but the last thing I need right now is pity. \n\nJames…Warden Sexton…his letters weren’t all love letters. There’s a report in here that says that the Corrupted are stockpiling ammunition.
"Can I help?"

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: Yes, you absolutely can. That ammunition would be far better off in our hands. The report says they’re smuggling it in fake barrels and burying them at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion.\n\nIf you find the ammunition, bring it here.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion have secret ammo caches located in false containers, and have likely buried some already.\n\nI don't want to think about James right now.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: What’s that? Oh, the ammunition. Sorry, I was miles away.\n\nYes, this is it. This ammunition should carry us through the next few raids. Thank you, Soulwarden.
"Are you going to be okay?"

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: I… don't know. I need to think.\n\nThanks for everything, but… this is something no one can help me with.

Explore Breakaway Fort

Explore Nullcavity

Travel to {POITags}

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName} Corrupted
Search for 'Twisted Smelter' entry
Search for 'Bonemeal' entry
Search for 'Ritual Mine' entry
Search for 'Clearcutting' entry
Rainbow Hearts, Shadowed Intent

Recover Soulwarden Heartgems from the Corrupted. Search for clues about the Corrupted plans in Breakaway Fort, Acedia Bastion, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity. Talk to Ranger Law in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Seems like a lot."

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: It’s… not ideal, no. It’s also not great that those forts are full of Corrupted Soulwardens. \n\nOur comrades and friends, who fought and fell beside us… They and the forts both belong to Corruption now.
"That's terrible."

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Ah, but now, things are different. Now, we’ve got you. \n\nCould you please try and recover Heartgems from my Corrupted friends at the forts? And while you’re there, keep an eye out for clues, weaknesses, secrets.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Please, return with any Heartgems you can in Acedia Bastion, Breakaway Fort, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity.\n\nI hope you'll also find more evidence about what the Corrupted are up to, or even more of those strange symbols.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: You brought back the Heartgems! Oh, wonderful. Now my friends won't be tortured anymore. \n\nYou also found… symbols? I’ve seen these before… the Corrupted carve them on the floating obelisks.
"What will you do with them?"

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: The Heartgems, we will purify. It’s really quite a beautiful ceremony. As for these papers, I’ll send them along to my friend. She’s working to crack the code, you see. Someday, she’ll succeed. \n\nThank you so much.
Travel to the {POITags} to recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns

string.comment: itemName = "Azoth Infused Lantern" , targetName = "Miststride" , POI = "Wayward Mounds" (Region)
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Retrieve {itemName} from Miststride Ghouls
A Burning Question
Recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns from Miststride Ghouls in the Eeriedune Graveyard and Misty Borough. Talk to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Why do you ask?"

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Have you heard of the ghost lights, the ignes fatui, the lanterns that flicker in the Eeriedune Graveyard? Never filled, never fueled, always burning? \n\nI need to learn more about their properties!
"What's special about them?"

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The Corrupted don't go near them. If we can find out why, maybe we can harness their protection as well! \n\nYou can find the lanterns at the Eeriedune Graveyard and in Misty Borough. Please, hurry back!

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Return the lanterns to me, so I can uncover their secrets.\n\nThey are quite distinct, you should have no problem following their glow.

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The lanterns... There's no light, no glow, not even a flicker! Yet they don't appear to be broken...\n\nWhatever causes them to glow must come from the Ghouls themselves...
"Can you use them?"

string.comment: chaíre = hee-YE-re, Greek for "see you soon"
string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: I plan on taking the lanterns apart to see how they work, of course. Perhaps if we find a way to light them, they'll still hold the Corrupted at bay. \n\nThank you for these, chaíre.

string.comment: itemName = "Blackened Talisman" , targetName = "Miststride Flailer" , POI = "Eeriedune Graveyard"
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName}
Recover {itemName} from {targetName}
Kill {targetName}
Travel to {POITags} to determine if Herald Abraxas will aid the Soulwardens
Travel to {POITags} to stop Herald Abraxas
Search for '​Pictures On The Wall' entry
Search for 'Scorched Earth' entry
Blessings of the Fallen
Discover how Herald Abraxas blessed Misty Borough, and determine if the Heralds will aid the Soulwardens. Talk to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Sounds wonderful."

string.comment: male referring to male (holy Herald = Herald Abraxas)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: It does, doesn’t it? I’ve been hearing stories about the Misty Borough and Herald Abraxas since I was a child. He’s something of a hero to me. \n\nIf only we had someone like him on our side in this fight… the war would be over tomorrow!
"Herald Abraxas?"

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: That's him! The legends say that he and his followers arrived in Misty Borough, seeking paradise. \n\nI wouldn't be surprised if they were still there. How wonderful that would be! Maybe they could even fight with us!

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: If it's true, and the Herald's sacred power truly does protect his village from Corruption, perhaps we could use it across the island!\n\nHe could bless all of Great Cleave and drive the Corrupted right back into the mountain they crawled out of!

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Ah! You're back! Will Herald Abraxas help us in the fight against the Corrupted?\n\nDid you discover how the hilltop is protected?
"Yes, but you're not going to like it."

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Oh… I see. They’re protected from Corruption because they became Lost. In any case, thank you. I’ll destroy these talismans. \n\nI guess some legends are better off staying legends.
Travel to {POITags} to recover stolen Heartgems
Defeat {targetName}
Reclaim {itemName}s from the Corrupted Pillars
Twisted Metamorphosis
Defeat Gravespoil Vicars in Capitulum Prime, and return the stolen Heartgems to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"Strange AND horrifying?"

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Yes, both! Rangers have reported the theft of a cache of Corrupted Heartgems. The same Heartgems you recovered from our former comrades at the fallen forts! \n\nI knew we shouldn’t have kept them all in one place…
"Who stole them?"

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The Gravespoil Vicars who haunt Capitulum Prime… los odio, I hate them. We think they’re using them in some kind of ghoulish ritual. \n\nI’m sorry to ask you recover the same Heartgems twice, but… please get them back!

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: We can't let the Gravespoil Vicars use those Heartgems in their rituals.\n\nThose were our friends, and we owe it to them to keep their souls safe!

string.comment: female referring to female (Warden = Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: You’re back! Did you recover the Heartgems? Or were we too late?
"I've got them safe and sound."

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Oh, thank the Spark. Yes, they’re all here… my old friends. I’d recognize them anywhere. \n\nThank you so much, {playerName}. I will be having serious words with whoever was storing all these Heartgems in one place.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka
Recover {itemName}
The Best of Us
Defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka, and return her Heartgem to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"What happened to her?"

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Ever since you brought the news of Sexton’s death… and, um, romantic betrayal… Dimka couldn’t take it. She was so sad, and angry, and embarrassed. In her despair, Corruption took her.
"Oh no, where is she?"

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: When she realized what was happening, she fled north. She didn’t want to hurt us. \n\nWe think she got as far as Sever Castra, before she fell. Oh, Dimka… I wish I could have helped her.

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: I’m sorry to ask for your help once again, but… you seem so strong. And you didn’t know Dimka like we did. Maybe that will make this easier. \n\nPlease, bring back her Heartgem. She deserves that much.

string.comment: male referring to female (her = Archaeologian Sauquillo)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: That's Dimka’s Heartgem. It's hard to believe that she's gone…\n\nShe was brilliant, kind, vibrant... and now, she's some twisted and Corrupted thing. Is this the fate that awaits us all?
"No. We will win this war."

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Yes… you’re right. This is why it’s so important for us to keep our spirits as high as we can, because if we don’t…\n\nThank you. I’ll lay Dimka’s purified Heartgem to rest next to Sexton’s… and Patricia’s.
Travel to {POITags}
The Winding Mountain Path
Deliver Orders to Soulwarden Ducquet of Valor Hold Outpost in Edengrove. Talk to Warden Yseult in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.
"Glad I could help."

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: If you're willing to continue helping the Soulwardens, there's another place that could really use it.\n\nIn Edengrove is the Valor Hold Outpost. They’re in the belly of the beast over there.
"What do they need?"

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: So much. Food, arms, reinforcements. Above all, they could use some good news. That’s you. \n\nTake this letter to Warden Ducquet in Valor Hold. Stick to the roads, though they're not much safer. Auf wiedersehen, my friend.

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Remember, stick to the path.\n\nI expect that Soulwarden Ducquet will be surprised to see you. I don't believe they've had outside news in months.
Your compass is backwards if you're heading for safety. You want safety, head for the coasts!\n\nAh, I see, orders from Soulwarden Owens? Let's have a look then…
"What's it say?"
Says you've bested a good measure of those Corrupted in Great Cleave, and you're here to help.\n\nWe could use the help, sure enough. Let's find something for you to do!
As Good As My Word
Find Ranger Heo Do-yun's previous associates. Once found, let them know Heo Do-yun is still alive.
Find and talk to Ranger Jasvir Tenavan
Find and talk to Ranger Marikit Rizal
You may have heard of me, lucky Heo. No? That's a first. \n\nHere I thought everyone knew how I survived the destruction of three separate bastions… not that it did me any good.

string.comment: First Quest: As Good as My Word
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: The story of how I came to be here is a long one, filled with much hardship. \n\nI have survived the destruction of three bastions, though many of the other rangers assigned there were not so lucky.
"How did you escape?"

I had the "good fortune" to be off scouting when the Corrupted struck. \n\nI was cut off from the others, but I was able to track them here. If we don't find them soon, I fear they may fall to Corruption.
"The Corrupted have been taking others too."
Then the situation is more dire than I thought. We rangers are a hardy lot, but some things no one should endure. \n\nIf you find them before I do, let them know I survived.
Please look for any surviving rangers. It would be heartening to know I wasn't the only survivor, this time.
Have you seen the Corrupted ahead? \n\nThey are up to something, and I intend to discover what it is!
I have never seen the Corrupted so active like they are here.\n\nI believe the enemy is going to make their final move soon.
"Did you know Heo Do-yun is alive?"
That man has more lives than a cat! If he survived there may yet be hope for the rest of us!
"He was really worried about you."
He's always worried about the rest of us! But I'm fine. \n\nI was able to get free on my own, but there are others nearby the Corrupted have taken. I couldn't just leave them.
The bastion Do-yun and I were stationed at may be overrun, but our work is not done. \n\nI shall stay here and watch the Corrupted so that next time we'll have warnings before they attack.
I'd give anything to be back at home, but home was destroyed and nowhere is safe anymore.
Ah! You've found me! Here I thought everyone had given up on us after our bastion was overrun. \n\nHave you found any others?
"Were you stationed with Heo Do-yun?"
I was, along with Jasvir. I feared the worst, but if you have news, that means all is not lost.
"Heo Do-yun is alive and looking for survivors."
He always was the best of us, always believing that Corruption could be overcome if we worked together. \n\nI'll finish here and head for safer ground. Thank you, friend!
Do-yun is brave to keep watch against the growing darkness. If he isn't giving up, neither am I. \n\nI'll patrol near here and send reports back about the movements of the Corrupted.
You have the look of someone who has good news! I take it others survived the attack?
"Yes, Jasvir and Marikit survived."
Things are looking up! Three are more than enough to start a new bastion, or at least a watchtower. \n\nWe'll build it at a strategic location to continue to spy on the Corrupted.
Map the landscape to the west
Map the landscape to the east
Mapping The Edge Of Despair
Find the best locations to map out enemy camps in northern Great Cleave. Then bring your notes back to Ranger Heo Do-yun.

string.comment: Second Quest: Mapping the Edge of Despair
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: It's obvious the Corrupted have plans for this area. Have you noticed how the breaches get worse when they are around? There is a clear connection. \n\nWe have to find a way to predict where they will strike next.
"Is that why you are still here?"

Yes. I was sent to map the supply lines of the Corrupted. With you here, we could cover more ground. \n\nI scouted out several promising locations, but I didn't have time to make maps, not before the bastion was destroyed.
"What am I looking for?"
I've set up telescopes and map paper at sites that overlook key Corrupted locations. \n\nIf you could travel to each one and make a fresh map to bring back to me, I would appreciate the extra help.
We need accurate maps if we are to track what the Corrupted are up to. Each piece of new information brings us closer to victory!
You, my friend, are an extremely competent mapmaker. I know it couldn't have been easy to write in the cold, but this linework is excellent!\n\nNow let me compare these to our older maps.
"Has there been any change?"

Hmm… not as much as I expected. And that troubles me. \n\nIt could mean their attention is elsewhere, somewhere we can't see. We'll have to look into this when we can, but something else needs my attention first.
Search {POITags} for Mardea's Shield and Hanu's Spear
Recover Mardea's Shield
Recover Hanu's Spear
Search {POITags} for Topalian's Helm and Kaipo's Axe
Recover Topalian's Helm
Recover Kaipo's Axe
Picking Up The Pieces
Recover weapons and armor from Ranger Heo Do-yun's fallen companions. Recover Mardea's Shield, Hanu's Spear, Topalian's Helm, and Kaipo's Axe.

string.comment: Third Quest: Picking Up the Pieces
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: Since the Corrupted have given us a bit of breathing room, I'm going to take this time to honor our fallen. \n\nThere are so many fine rangers that didn't make it out of the bastions alive.
"How do you plan on honoring them?"

When we build a new bastion, I plan on putting their prized weapons and armor on display so that we never forget their sacrifices. \n\nEach of them left something behind. Until now, I haven't had the time to recover them.
"What do you need me to find?"

Mardea never had time to recover her shield. Hanu went down with her spear. Topalian's helm was knocked off during the attack. And Kaipo's axe whirled through many before he fell. With those, I can honor my lost friends.
Their warrior spirits will live on forever, but those of us who didn't fall would be reminded about their strength and courage if we had something to remember them by.

Mardea's Shield, as good at absorbing blows as she was hardship. Hanu's quick wit, as sharp as the spear she fought with. \n\nTopalian's Helm, as bright as their personality. And Kaipo's Axe, as large as his generosity.
"They sound like good friends."
They were. And with these items, it's as if they're standing right beside me. \n\nI can hear their voices now, laughing about my luck. I'll toast their bravery later.
Just you wait, our next bastion will be our best yet! \n\nThe Corrupted won't overrun it so easily, thanks to your help!
The Balemaw Beast
Find the notorious Balemaw Beast which has been preying on travelers in the region.
Follow clues to the Balemaw Beast
Confront the false Balemaw Beast
There are troubling rumors that haunt these roads. Tales of the Balemaw Beast, of winter wolves, and even Yetis mauling innocent travelers. \n\nBe wary!
Greetings, may you stay safe on the roads. \n\nThere have been troubling tales lately of a beast that roams the nearby woods which preys upon unsuspecting travelers.
"What manner of beast?"

The Balemaw Beast is taller than a person and covered in fur! It has glowing eyes that pierce through the snow and claws as long as daggers. \n\nIt jumps out from behind the trees and vanishes into the woods just as quickly.
"Has it harmed anyone?"

That's where the tale gets muddy. Some say it attacked them, others say it runs off without a fight. \n\nEither way, it's a menace and I'd appreciate it if you tracked down the truth behind the rumors.
Have you discovered any clues to the whereabouts of the Balemaw Beast?
Rawr! Grah! Oh! You’re not from around here. \n\nLook, just, don't tell anyone I'm here, alright?
Rawr! Grah! Hey, you aren't running away! And... is that a weapon? \n\nWhatever I did, I can explain!
"Wait, you're the beast that's been attacking people?"

string.speaker: Bob the Balemaw Beast - Great Cleave
string.name: BobTheBeast

resources.string: I swear, all I do is jump out at people! I haven't hurt anyone. \n\nThis all started as just a harmless bit of fun, so that people could see the myth without any danger.
I swear, my scaring days are over. \n\nI'll head back to the settlement soon, I promise.
From your expression you have discovered something… Please let it not be another body. \n\nTell me truthfully, I can handle the worst.
"The so called beast was just a guy named Bob."
So, the dreaded Balemaw Beast was just a person out for a bit of fun. What kind of fool thinks that's a good idea? \n\nGreat Cleave is full of real terrors, there's no need to add imaginary ones!
Wolves Of Winter
Track the beasts that have been attacking travelers to their lair and defeat them.
Discover what manner of beast lives at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Speaking of real terrors, while you were off tracking the Balemaw Beast, there have been reports of more attacks on the northern road. \n\nThis time by creatures with glowing blue eyes.
"Are the eyes significant?"
The color of the eyes, along with their ability to manipulate ice, leads me to believe that these creatures aren't natural. \n\nWe can't allow them to make a home here in Great Cleave!
"Any ideas where the creatures might be?"
There are a number of caves where they might have made a home for themselves. \n\nI suggest you check them to make sure.
Have you checked the nearby ice caves? What about the ones farther away? We have to be sure they aren't spreading.
You look like you've been in quite a fight. Was it with the Yeti? Have you banished it?
"There are no Yetis here, just the Terror of Great Cleave."
Ah, those rimewolves are vicious. Clearing them out certainly helps protect the travelers in these woods. \n\nI wonder if having them around means we're less likely to have Yetis move into the area?
The Beast Returns
The Balemaw Beast struck again! Track the beast up Mangled Heights and defeat it!
Check on Bob the "Balemaw Beast"
Travel to {POITags} to find clues about the real Balemaw Beast
Collect {itemName} as clues from {targetName}
Travel to {POITags} to find the Balemaw Beast
Defeat {targetName}
I hate to bring it up again, but there have been more news of the Balemaw Beast. These tales are far more gruesome from the last. \n\nThey talk of travelers getting ripped limb from limb.
"Do I need to check on Bob again?"
It wouldn't hurt. Though I can't imagine Bob has a hand in this, unless we were vastly mistaken about the nature of his character. \n\nHe seemed harmless. Misguided and foolish, but harmless.
"Other than Bob do we have any leads?"
The tales tell of horrors up in Mangled Heights. Sadly, this is nothing new. \n\nAll news from the heights are filled with tragic stories of travelers who got in over their heads.
These are dark days indeed if such beasts wander the land. \n\nI had thought we had taken care of the Balemaw Beast last time, but it seems we were mistaken.
It hurts… get help…
"Bob! What happened here?"

string.speaker: Bob the Balemaw Beast - Great Cleave
string.name: BobTheBeast

resources.string: It's real… the beast… I didn't believe… not really. \n\nIt headed up the mountain. I think it took my spleen…
When I get back, I'm done impersonating that… thing.
Has it been taken care of? Has the beast been destroyed?
"Mozrul the Herald has been defeated."
Let's hope that is enough to make those roads safe again. Though I fear Mozrul will be back again in the future. \n\nThank you for your help.
Your help is like a beacon, shining hope onto this cursed ground. \n\nYour next visit is sure to chase away the gloom.
A Spot Of Luxury
Gather beautiful Spotted Pelts from Bobcats to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Bobcats in Frosted Floe to gather Spotted Pelts
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Have you seen the creatures out here? Don't you think their coats are absolutely divine? \n\nThe stripes, the patterns, they are all so luscious!

string.comment: First Quest: A Spot of Luxury
string.speaker: Furrier Horne
string.name: RueHorne

resources.string: Good fashion is to die for! But best is to have others die for it rather than ourselves, yes?
"Yes?"
I could tell you were one with a fine eye for fashion. Really, your outfit, superb! I couldn't design something better myself.
"Thanks, I think."
Don't think, be! Fashion is all about being. And being covered in spots is going to be so in next year! \n\nDo be a dear and kill some bobcats to bring me their spotted pelts, would you?
I must have those spotted pelts! Do hurry back soon!
You found me, good! With you helping to procure the bobcat pelts, I felt I had to scout out what I simple needed to collect next. But first, let's take a look at those pelts.
"How do you like them?"
Divine, simply divine! I do so love the feel of fresh pelts. \n\nThere's something so vital about them. So intense.
Fabulous Furs
Gather fantastically colored pelts from local cougars and elk to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Snowy Cougars in the Braided Hills to gather Red Striped Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Snowy Cougar
Hunt Tainted Stags in the Icy Wilds to gather Blue Striped Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Tainted Stag
Speaking of intense, have you seen the colors of the fur on some of the animals up here? \n\nThat striking red, that vibrant blue!
"The colors are unusual."
More than unusual, they are extremely profitable! Those hues will mean I save a fortune on dyes! \n\nThe stripes are quite striking too. I simply must add them to my collection.
Those colors! They make me weak just thinking about them! I must have them!
Oh. My. They are even better in person than from afar. Oh, and so soft. So supple. \n\nEveryone will be clamoring to wear these, and it's all possible because of you.
"It wasn't easy."
Good fashion is never easy. That's what makes it so good. \n\nAnd you, dear, are one of the best. I can just tell.
Pure Delight
Gather brilliant Pure White Pelts from wolves to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Alabaster Wolves in the Icy Wilds to gather Pure White Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Alabaster Wolf
Speaking of the best, while traveling here I saw some simply magnificent fur. \n\nIt was pure as the snow. Can you imagine the possibilities?
"They won't be easy to clean."
Your concern is touching. But trust me, anyone buying pure white pelts are not worried about how to keep them clean! \n\nI simply must have them!
Those pelts are a blank slate just waiting to be gobbled up by fashion. Do be hasty in bringing them back!
Oh, what a wonder! Imagine enfolding yourself in these furs! Why, you'd sink into them and give up wearing anything else. \n\nSuch fine work, it's like you were born to be in fashion.
"I have other interests."
Everyone does! But fascinating hobbies are what keep the best designers inspired. \n\nShould you ever want to focus on fashion, do come back and see me!
Oh, you simply must stop by again! I love seeing what you're wearing. \n\nTruly, your choices are inspirational! Now, how do you feel about wearing more fur?
White As Bone
Collect Ancient Ivory for Valta so she can add it to a poppet.
Search for Ancient Ivory in {PoiTags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Can you hear it on the breeze? How children's laughter rustles through the leaves?
Oh how I long for a child of my own. \n\nTo run through the snow in wonder, to see this world through new eyes.
"But I have seen no children here."
I have not seen children either, but I have listened long to tales older than this island. And I am certain there is a way. \n\nAll I need are some components to place into a poppet.
"A poppet, you mean like a doll?"

A doll yes, but so much more. For like calls to like, and once complete it shall call forth a child. \n\nCould you bring me some bones to place inside? I have already tried snow, but it does not last long enough.
I need bones of the Ancients to make this work.
These bones, so old, and yet they have not faded away. Something makes these Ancient bones special. Something I hope will imbue this spell with longevity and strength.
Red As Blood
Collect blood red Firebright Rubies from the mine for Valta so she can add them to a poppet.
Collect Firebright Rubies in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
There is much yet that needs to be collected if I am to have a child. \n\nSomething that glistens like fresh blood, yet does not fade away. Something that keeps its color, brilliant and bright.
"Could red dye work?"

I tried dyes before, sadly they all failed. This time I shall try rubies, blood red in color. They don’t fade with time, always staying bright. \n\nThere’s a mine not far from here where rubies can be collected.
I need bright shining rubies to make this spell work. \n\nI tried blood and dye before, but those didn't last long enough.
How deep their color, like blood that has been caught and frozen in time. \n\nSee how they catch the light? These are perfect to capture the spirit of survival anyone on Aeternum needs.
Black As Ebony
Collect night black pieces of Charred Ebony for Valta so she can add them to a poppet.
Collect Charred Ebony in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
I am so close now, so close to my dream. There is one more component I need. Ebony, a rare wood even if this was not Aeternum. \n\nI fear it will be impossible to find.
"You can't give up now, I'm sure we can find some."

I have heard rumors that someone brought ebony furniture to one of the forts. You could search there and see what you could find. \n\nI fear the worst, as the rumors also told of the forts being overrun.
"If it's there, I'll find it."
Thank you. Please hurry. The poppet is almost done, and I can feel my child calling to me.
All I require now are charred pieces of ebony. Soon, my child soon, you shall know peace in my arms.
Perfect, perfect. The bones are inside, with rubies for the heart and eyes, and charred pieces of ebony to hold it all together. \n\nThe poppet is complete!
"Is that all that must be done?"
No, making the poppet was just the first step. \n\nNow it is time to visit the Wishing Tree.
An Offering For Offspring
Travel to the Wishing Tree and leave the Poppet as an offering so that Valta may one day have a child of her own.
Travel to the Wishing Tree
Place Valta's Poppet at the Wishing Tree

string.comment: Fourth Quest: An Offering for Offspring
string.speaker: Arcanist Niskanen
string.name: ValtaNiskanen

resources.string: Tales say that the Wishing Tree grants wishes, but only if you have made a sufficient offering.
"Who decides what is sufficient?"

I don't know. What I do know is that none of my previous offerings worked. The poppet of snow and blood and ash barely lasted a day before it melted away. \n\nThe poppet of paper and dye didn't fare much better.
"What makes you so sure of this time?"

Bones of Ancient guardians, rubies, ebony… if the offering is not sufficient this time, I do not know what I shall do. \n\nPlease take it to the tree for me. I do not think I can bear to go through with it again.
Please take the poppet to the Wishing Tree. I can hear the voice of my child even now.
Something is different, I can feel it. \n\nThe air has a hint of warmth to it. The wind holds fewer sighs.
"But no child appeared."
These things take time. We must be patient. \n\nThe tales did not say how long it would take for the offering to be accepted, only that given time, it would.
The poppet has been placed. All there is to do now is wait. \n\nSoon I shall start to sew a blanket for my child in anticipation of their arrival.
Perfect Piroshkis
Gather Dried Dill, Crumbly Aged Cheese, and Tenderized Meat for Aksinya.
Collect Dried Dill at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect Crumbly Aged Cheese at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect Tenderized Meat from Tainted Stags in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Oh those poor hungry dears. \n\nThe Soulwardens need something that sticks to their ribs and keeps them warm, if they are going to keep up their fight!
You look like you could use a good meal. Just like those Soulwardens.
"Supplies have been low up here."
Tell me about it! Why, I haven't had new deliveries in quite some time, and it shows. \n\nI've got plenty of potatoes, but there are only so many ways you can cook them.
"You can add cheese, spices..."

I could, if we had any left! You know things are bad when even the cheese supplies run low. \n\nTell you what, you bring me some Dried Dill, Crumbly Aged Cheese, and some Tenderized Meat, and I'll whip up some food for us!
What I wouldn't give for some spices, cheese… anything to brighten the potatoes and onions I already have on hand.
You did it! I almost can't believe it, it's been so long since I've seen something other than potatoes to eat! \n\nTell me I'm not dreaming.
"Oh, they're real. What are you going to make?"
Piroshkis! I have the flour for the dough, the onions, and so many potatoes. \n\nBut now I can make them truly delicious with the dill, cheese, and tender meat. We'll be feasting soon!
To Warm The Soul Warden
Bring Piping-Hot Piroshkis to Soulwarden Pedro Carrillo at Warden's Rise before they get cold!
Travel to {POITags} Outpost to bring Piping-Hot Piroshkis to Soulwarden Pedro Carrillo before they get cold
Travel to {POITags} Outpost in {timeRemaining}

string.comment: Second Quest: To Warm the Soul Wardens
string.speaker: Baker Krupin
string.name: AksinyaKrupin

resources.string: Thank you so much for bringing the ingredients. \n\nNow that I have what I need, I want to do something to help the Soulwardens at Warden's Rise.
"Why not here at the Bastion?"
I've already made food for everyone stationed here, and I want to spread the bounty around. \n\nI can't imagine the kind of swill they are eating over there, the poor dears.
"They don’t have a cook like you over there."

All the more reason to run this basket of Piping-Hot Piroshkis over to Warden's Rise before they get cold! \n\nAlas, you can't use the Spirit Shrine as it disrupts the delicate flavor of the piroshkis.
Off with you! You don't want those piroshkis to get cold, do you? \n\nWithout being able to use the Spirit Shrine, you'll need to get a move on!
Supplies might be hard to come by, but I'm not leaving. \n\nSomeone needs to stay and keep morale up, one piroshki at a time.
That smells wonderful! Marvelous! I haven't had any food that smelled this good for… I don't remember how long! What's the occasion?
"Aksinya Krupin just wanted to say thanks."
That woman is a treasure! \n\nNow if only she would move to Warden's Rise we would be eating like kings!
Prime Resolve
Growth From the Stem
Funnelling In
Flamestarters
Reagent Retrieval
Head of the Pack
Swirling Staff Base
Flintlock

Gather Blistering Reagents from Corrupted at Greater Tribulation.
Gather a Curved Staffhead from Angry Earth at Eridanus.
Gather a Swirling Staff Base from Angry Earth at Malevolence.
Gather Orichalcum Flintlock from Undead Pirates at Stone Skull Fort.
Defeat Articulon The Unshackled in the Mangled Heights for an Azoth Concentrator.

Climb the tower {POITags} in search of a base for your staff
Defeat {targetName} Dryads

Search for flintlocks at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
Search chests within {POITags} for {itemName}
Delve into the {POITags} in search of an Azoth Concentrator
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
"What did you hear?"

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Here in Aeternum, where doom haunts our every move, we must hang on to the things that make us feel alive.\n\nTo that end, there is a legend we tell in Great Cleave that warms our hearts.
"How does it go?"

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: There is a powerful fire staff, called Prime Resolve. The legend goes that it can turn a Corrupted enemy to cinders in a flash. \n\nI’d call that heartwarming, wouldn’t you?
"Is it real?"

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Yes, if you make it so! Go forth and gather the parts needed to build this legendary weapon!\n\nSetting things on fire, what a wonderful way to remind yourself you're truly alive.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Isn’t fire wonderful? It keeps us warm, cooks our food, burns away the darkness and the filth and the pain… \n\nOnce you craft your own fire staff, you’ll understand.
At last, Prime Resolve is completed. It’s beautiful. Truly a force to be reckoned with!\n\nKnowing you wield it will keep me warm during my cold patrols.
"I'll burn a few Corrupted in your name."
You're too kind. May Prime Resolve turn you into a beacon of fiery hope.\n\nA burning flame that refuses to go out as it purifies Corruption.
Glimmering Mercy

Gather the parts, wholesome and true, for a life-giving staff made whole. Glittering, gleaming, restore and renew the Glimmering Mercy's soul. Talk to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.
"Yes, I've been there."

string.comment: male referring to female (Ranger Madaki), male referring to male (Ranger Rochford)
string.speaker: Ranger Balogun - Great Cleave
string.name: RangerBalogun

resources.string: That place has eaten many careless Soulwardens. Your accomplishment is impressive… to some. \n\nBut no one triumphs alone, do they? I’ve heard you’ve been getting help from my friend Madaki in Shattered Mountain.
"We all need help, now and then."

Some of us. Madaki said you've made a discovery about the Corrupted's weaponry. Let's see the pages you've found.\n\nOh! The plans for this staff, Glimmering Mercy, are actually a song. That’s whimsical.
"It's a song?"

The plans are a collection of short bits compiled into a poem called the "Symphony of Mercy."\n\nIf you're serious about practicing Life Magic, follow these lyrics to get your hands on the Glimmering Mercy.

Getting lost in song is quite easy, which explains Rochford. Maybe I myself should follow his tune a little more!\n\nIf you're confused on your path, check the scribbled notes in your Journal and follow the symphony.

So, you've learned the Symphony of Mercy? I won't pretend to know the work of musicians, but I can at least whistle a tune as I work.\n\nGive me a moment to extract the essences I need, and I'll finish crafting the Mercy.
"It's looking good."

Yes, this is a fine Life Staff. Just seeing it glimmer puts my heart at ease. Wielding the Mercy in battle will inspire awe in your allies and fear in your enemies.\n\nTake it, in your hands I know this staff will do some good.
Prelude of the Acolytes
Blood-stained robes and cursed staves, nefarious acolytes raise their minions forth. Find them in the heights west by north, and send them to their cursed graves.
The Wyrdwood Adagio
Weeping trees, they be not willow nor withe, growing wild in the winding way. Survive the wanton whaling of the forestwalkers, and your woes be rewarded with the trees' blue tears.
Shaman's Scherzo
Another place, another body, another time, the wisest of shamans are not of here but a reality that bends. The myrrh they carry is their vehicle, the key to a magic that transcends.
The Stone Skull Shanty

One swig for courage, two swigs to sleep, three swigs to settle your strife, and four swigs when under the knife. Give me that bottom of the barrel wine, freshly butchered swine, and a wench for a good time.
Zarabanda del Ojo Rojo
The red eye of the bay, the red eye of the bay, the tower calling sailors to their doom. Deep in the tower, hidden away, an ancient and powerful rune.
Requiem for the Lost
Temporary forms made immortal and pinned to the earth in sorrow. The faithless turn their back on the path.
Passepied de la Tour
In the heart of the craters, the soul of Aeternum, climb towards the sky. Peek into the mirror and learn the ways of those that defend the tower.
Sonata of the Shattered
Dive into the belly of the beast, and the heart of Corruption. Though light may cast out the darkness, it in turn casts a shadow.
Ascend into the {POITags} in search of Corrupted Wood shards
Collect Infernal Corrupted Wood shards from Unhallowed Devouts

Seek Wyrdwood from the {POITags}

Defeat Joan the Faithless for her Broken Talisman

Complete Quest: Wooden Hearts and Iron Heads
Complete Quest: Sticking to the Plan
Complete Quest: The Gleaming Edge
Recover the components needed to create the Azure Ravager, and deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
Forging the Azure Ravager
"It's all true."
I know. I started seeing the influx of strange items coming into the forts nearby, and I didn't question her any longer.\n\nSomething unusual was going on, so I started to look into it.
"What did you find?"
There is an amazing hatchet, I'm sure Madaki showed you. I can imagine the way it handles in a fight!\n\nWe can't let the Corrupted make it first!
"What should I do?"

I've put together a list of everything that matches up with this new Hatchet design.\n\nYou'll have to search across Aeternum for some of the items, but I'm certain you can do it. You found me up here, after all.
I’d love to join you, but I have other duties. I have to try and stop any more of those supplies from reaching the forges in Caminus.\n\nI’m sure you can find all the items on that list by yourself!
Glad you made it back. Wow, some of this stuff must have been hard to find. Nicely done.\n\nGive me a bit to integrate these last components you've brought, and we'll see what we end up with.
"Hopefully, a hatchet."

This is no ordinary hatchet! Whoever designed it was a master smith. 

A name is coming to me: Azure Ravager, the slayer of Corrupted. 

Yes, that’s got a nice ring to it!

Wooden Hearts and Iron Heads
There are still a few more items on Fowler's shopping list, and I still have a lot to do to make sure this Hatchet won't do anything crazy, like try and suck your soul out.\n\nKidding... I think.
"Are you sure about this?"
Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what will happen when this weapon is finished.\n\nAll I do know for certain is that we'll have it and they won't... and that'll hurt them in more ways than one.
You bring me the components, and I'll get this thing made. The faster you bring everything back, the faster you can use this weapon on those damned Corrupted.

It looks like you've made a lot of progress already! I've been working to alter this recipe to channel azoth instead of Corruption... and with what you've brought me, I think I'll be able to make this work.
"Sounds like a good plan."
By the time you bring back the rest of the components, I'll have most of the critical pieces complete.\n\nThen we'll get to see what this design can really do.

A great haul, wonderfully done! While you've been out, I was able to stop three other shipments from making their way to the forges of Caminus.\n\nFelt good to be up and active, you know?
"I do."
Oh, Ranger Madaki sent a runner earlier, in case you stopped by. She's almost completed the Hatchet, and it looks like with what you have, she'll have the final pieces she needs. Hurry up there!

Recover the components needed to create the Rampant Conviction, then deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
The Rampant Conviction of Hope
"Why do you ask?"

I've received her instructions, and have set my efforts to stopping the production of Corrupted weapons.\n\nTo that end, I've compiled reports to track the weapons that have recently passed through the valley.
"That's quite a task."
It needed to be done. It's safe to assume that most, if not all, of the items are related to the creation of this Hammer.\n\nI've organized them into a list for you, to aid you in your endeavor.
"This will be useful, thanks."
You're welcome. I shall continue my efforts to stop the Corrupted here.\n\nI leave the rest in your capable hands. Best of luck.
Be watchful, stick to the shadows, and don’t move until you need to. This tactic has served me well over the years. \n\nIt will serve you too, if you embrace it.
Didn't get too lost out there, I hope?\n\nLet's take a look at what you brought me, hm? Oh, yes... these will do nicely for what's needed.
"It's a fine piece of work."
Indeed. A beautiful weapon. It needs a name...\n\nI've got it! The Rampant Conviction of Hope. A little long, but I like it. Take it, and show those Corrupted just how strong our hope is.

Great work, {playerName}. I haven’t been idle either. \n\nEight caravans attempted to bring additional supplies through the valley…they will not reach their destinations.
"What did you find?"
Some items were clearly to be used for this Hammer, among other weapons.\n\nNo matter. Return these components to Ranger Madaki, and she will work to create a weapon of note.

Frostbitten Fighters
Gather components to make the Legendary Ice Gauntlet Rimelash.
Gather the Corrupted Bindings that will hold together the gauntlet from Legatus General Patrick at Svikin's Stand. Talk to Ranger Madaki at Shattered Mountain.
Gather the Frozen Orichalcum Plating from the frozen crown of North Myrkgard, Greater Tribulation.
Gather the Chilled Fungi that grow upon the Elite Alcazarian Guardians of Malevolence for an extra kick of frost.
Kill Corrupted on the way to gather S'ylanx the Unseen's frozen, twisted heart to make a core for the gauntlet.
Gather Frostforged Grips to make up the hand of the gauntlet from the Corrupted of Caminus.
Gather Everbite Ectoplasm from the wraiths of frigid Periville, their cold everlasting in undeath.
Gather Icy Shot from the Skullworm Pirates of Stone Skull Fort, a special ammunition they keep on them for inflicting maximum pain.
Defeat Dryads and their leader Parthenocissus for his Frostbitten Vine that will wrap around the core of the gauntlet.
"You aren't just talking about the weather..."

Just think of it, holding the power of a snowstorm in one's hand. \n\nThere's a weapon that allows for this and more, the gauntlet Rimelash. With it you can freeze enemies and shatter their frozen forms.
"Sounds impressive!"
It is! Rimelash's cold seeps into the very marrow of an enemy, freezing them from the inside-out. \n\nThis is exactly the kind of weapon we could use, if you're willing to take on its construction.
"How do I start?"
Great Cleave is a wonderful place, if you seek the power of winter. The creatures here have ice in their veins – take it from them. \n\nOnce you get the pieces, Madaki can help you put them together.
This land is full of shifting forces greater than all of us. But we won’t be afraid. We will master them, in time. \n\nGo and master the power of winter, and bring Rimelash into the world once more.
What a resounding success! I present to you: Rimelash, the instrument of icy destruction that will freeze and fell your enemies before they even know what's hit them!
"I've got shivers thinking about it."
It is a great boon to have this weapon in the hands of someone so capable.\n\nThe Corrupted will shatter under its power.

Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
No. Not that! Please. You don't have to hurt me. \n\nI'll make the bombs. All of them. I-I'll give them to your Captain.

Have you had a chance to talk to the people here? It's inspiring to see them stay strong through such adversity. \n\nI came here for my son, but I'm staying for them. The least I can do is provide them with decent meals.
I am a seeker of stories. \n\nTell me, warrior. Do you have any tales for me?

The Soulwardens told me about how you fought Captain Thorpe. \n\nBut I want to hear all the details from you. What weapons did you use? Did you die at any point or could you keep fighting through his attacks?
Do you see the red tides around us? They are an omen of the bloody war to come. \n\nDon't worry, soldier. The 19th Legion is invincible. We will make Pompey pay for his sins against the Senate.
"Pompey already paid for his sins. A thousand years ago."
Oh. That's - maybe, it's possible. The island plays tricks with my mind. \n\nPlans of the past. Plans of the future. War after war. The lines start getting blurry after a while.
Don't come too close. I prefer not seeing the faces of the people I may have to kill. \n\nThere's a fool among us, who is spying on us in exchange for Corrupted coin. Pray it isn't you.
Be gentle with Shang. The Corrupted put her through a lot, trying to get her to make explosives for them. \n\nI left my mark on their red skulls and I'll happily destroy anyone who threatens her.
Hah. Good work breaking down the Corrupted mining operations. \n\nFirst go for their morale. Then go for their heads when they're bent in anguish.

Tell me, what ails you? If it's something minor, Mabel can help. \n\nA group of soldiers is expected back at the Eastern Outpost. Their wounds will be grave and their time will be less. I must hurry to them.
I rushed here as soon as I heard about Yonas's condition. \n\nHave you done anything to stem the bleeding? Keep his head upright and keep checking his heartbeat.

I hope you're faring well, traveler. You know, Tapas helped my brother in his last days, and now, he helps all of us. \n\nWhen the world gets overwhelming, remember there are still healers like him who roam the island.
Oh no! This is terrible. How are you coping, {playerName}! \n\nYonas secured the outposts and made us feel safe again. It's a shame to see him like this.

You look like you've just come from the battlefield. What keeps you sane through your struggles?\n\nFor me, it is the people here. Ingram's warmth, Wang's wit, Heyl's strength. We look out for each other.
Haha! Is it true you've found more Soulwardens? And one named Yash? \n\nHe's a jolly fellow from what I remember. Hope he hasn't changed too much after his dealings with the Corrupted.
Yes, I stand here, greeting weary adventurers like yourself. \n\nGuiding souls to the inn, the soulless to the winds and the Corrupted to Heyl's sword.
Greetings, {playerName}! I go by the name Lady Taehwa. I gave up my first name when I failed to save my brother from the Corrupted. \n\nI come out here everyday, hoping to receive news about him.
I heard you rescued more Soulwardens. Any news of my brother? \n\nHe's a Taehwa like me. Taller with long black hair and a moustache.
We are lucky to be reborn as we are. \n\nI feel like I'm cheating karma every time I don't get reborn as a lizard, especially after all the wrong that I have done.
Stay wary in this cave, stranger! I fear the ice wolves have a magic I haven't come across before. \n\nThose seemingly innocuous patterns on the wall? They blinded me when I touched them.
"What if these patterns belong to a different language?"

You know, that's possible. But these symbols are so different from each other, it seems like they don't belong to the same system. \n\nWe have so many unique languages in the Old World. I'm sure Aeternum has others that we've never seen.
Read
Ice Chronicles
Find Kazu, the owner of the journal. Maybe he can teach you more about the glyphs in Aeternum.
(A journal that looks like it was carelessly forgotten. \n\nIt could be a daydreaming owner, could be a person running from danger...)

A glyph in its smallest unit seems to denote a word. Some patterns have single glyphs. While some have many glyphs joined together to form a complex word. \n\nGiven the location of these glyphs, one could assume they have some connection with the Ancient monuments.
Don't hurt the wolf. It's done me no harm!
"Read further."

Could the glyphs reveal how the Ancient Guardians are powered? Could this knowledge be useful for our fight against Corruption? I must continue my search and list every glyph I find. \n\nThe merchant mentioned seeing a different sort of symbol on the cave of the ice wolves. I must head there next. - Kazu Ishida.

Could the glyphs reveal how the Ancient Guardians are powered? Could this knowledge be useful for our fight against Corruption? I must continue my search and list every glyph I find. \n\nThe merchant mentioned seeing a different sort of symbol on the cave of the ice wolves. I must head there next. - Kazu Ishida.
Is this really my journal? The leather cover, the embossed kanji. The words I'll never see- \n\nDo not touch that glyph. It looks harmless, but it has a strange magic.
"It looks more rounded than the symbols on the monuments."
Yes, I noticed that too. This pattern has an almost feral quality. The glyphs at the Ancient sites seem so refined in comparison. \n\nInteresting that these patterns could exist in the same language.
Go to Kazu
Speak with Kazu
Glyph Of The Wolf
Kazu turned blind when he tried to activate the strange new glyph. Help him research a similar one at Mokosh Springs.

The merchant said he saw similar symbols at a nearby waterfall. \n\nI must find a way to get there and search the place. We need every advantage we can get against the demons that inhabit this island.
"I can be your eyes."

Then you shall be of great help, my friend. Be careful. Do not touch the glyph or you may suffer a fate similar to mine. \n\nThe ice wolves may also have been linked to the shards that pierced my eyes, but I'm not sure.
Did you find the symbol? \n\nIt will look similar to the one in the caves.

Yoku dekita! You have proved yourself a valuable ally today. Did you really see an ice wolf near this glyph too? \n\nI wonder if these symbols are somehow connected to the beasts. I need more examples before I can be sure.
Go to Mokosh Springs
Examine the wolf glyph
Talk to the ice wolf
Once we understand the island more, we can tap into its powers to keep ourselves and our communities safe. \n\nI wish you luck on your journey, friend. I hope our paths cross again one day.

Have you ever felt like today is exactly as yesterday was, till the days themselves bleed into each other and you start to doubt the existence of time? \n\nI'm cursed to repeat the same day over and over again. It's so exasperating!
The Curse That Goes Round
Break the curse that has Simone going around in circles.

I don't believe I've seen you before. You seem different, an extra element in this stationary world. \n\nYou may be the answer to the curse. Oh, please, please, help me break free from whatever magic has been placed upon me!
"What is this curse?"

My day keeps looping in on itself. I wake up, I walk a few meters. I lose consciousness. I wake up. I start again. \n\nAlways the same path. I could tell you the exact patterns on the trees around us. I've seen them so many times!
"Who would wish you evil?"

My aunt. She made me leave France after I revealed what she did with the Duke. \n\nIf ever there was a woman capable of hatred, of vengeance, it would be her. Please find whatever vile thing she's put in my bags and remove it.
Did you find the curse my aunt placed upon me? \n\nDid you remove it? Please, tell me you removed it!
Well? What cursed thing did my aunt leave in my bag? \n\nThere must be a cross, tied leaves, a potion? At the very least, a note?
"I found an amulet."
Aha! It is the culprit. Thank you for saving me! \n\nTake the amulet or toss it away. I have no place for my aunt or her evildoings in my life.
Go to Ascension Rime
Find Simone's bag to break the curse
My aunt's magic is stronger than I expected. Oh, she torments me with her traps. \n\nI fear I'm forever doomed to repeat this life. If only there was a way to escape!
A Passing Good Knight
Assist an aged and possibly delusional knight with his plan to impress the Soulwardens.
Fie on the Corrupted!
Hail, ser. I am a worthy knight, come from afar in search of the Soulwardens. \n\nBut alas, I was refused. It is no order for the elderly, they told me.
“You are a bit old.”
Age has not dimmed my valor. I will prove this to the Soulwardens. \n\nNorth of here lies a Corruption stronghold known to hold their foul war designs. I intend to extract them, as it were.
"You want to steal their battle plans?"

Indeed I do, but I could use an ally. What say you? 

Breach the interior, search the chests for plans, and I’ll do the same. Afterwards, meet me north of the fort. 

At Arms! For the Soulwardens!
With our forces combined, we shall prevail against the Corrupted!
"I found their battle plans."
By my troth, that was well fought. \n\nYou have truly earned the that most noble of titles: a passing good knight.
Go to {POITags}
Search chests for battle plans
Armed At All Points
Kill the Siege Engineers at {POITags}.
No quarter for Siege Engineers!
"No quarter!"
Let us take measure of these plans. Hmm. \n\nWhat treachery is this? Those villains are building Siege Engines to wreak destruction upon the Soulwardens.
"Siege engines?"
In sooth, I don’t understand their exact purpose, but wit ye well, they intend great harm to the Wardens.
"We can’t allow that."
Verily. The Siege Engineers are toiling nearby. If we defeat them now, their evil schemes die also. \n\nOnce more I entreat your aid. Not for my sake, but for the Wardens. Let’s to it! At arms!
‘Siege Engineers’ are building weapons of war nearby. We must defeat them so the evil never comes to pass.
"I killed my share of Siege Engineers."
That was… the stuff of legends. The Soulwardens are safe… for now.
Go to {POITags}
Defeat the Siege Engineers at {POITags}
Battle Wounds Bestow Honor
Alas and alack! As Sir Hotspur lays stricken, accept the mantle and report to the Soulwardens.
Let not my blood be spilt in vain.
Those fiends gave me such a buffet that I can’t even stand. \n\nIt vexes me to stay behind, but the Soulwardens must be made known of the evil designs against them.
"You do look bad."
Indeed, and I hurt the more so. \n\nOne last favour I ask of you. There is a map to the Soulwardens buried in a certain grave. Follow it and bear them report on the Siege Engineers. *cough* At arms!
Find the map buried in a grave. It shall lead you to the Soulwardens. Warn them of the dire threat against them.
"Hotspur and I foiled a plot against you."
Hello {playerName}, I’m Zhen Chang, a Soulwarden assigned to Eastburn Outpost.\n\nHow are you liking the cold? I wish I had stayed home insteading of heading into this snowy waste.
If it's not one thing, it's another.\n\nNo rest for the weary, friend. Not when there's work to be done.
Did that odd-talking old fool put you up to this, the one with all the armor? Well, perhaps not such a old fool after all.
"He fought bravely."

Oh? Great courage sometimes comes in unusual vessels. Wrinkly and withered, but such results cannot be disputed. Perhaps he has the making of a Soulwarden after all. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
Go to {POITags}
Dig up the map to the Soulwardens

Why did you join the war efforts?

The Corrupted took Yuki from me. My darling dog helped me be less serious, especially when he'd tilt his head sideways and poke his tongue out at me. \n\nNow, I have nothing but the war. I will send the Corrupted back to whatever hell they've come from.
Kazu has a gentle heart and a strong will to rid the island of Corrupted. \n\nThank you for helping him this far. WE will protect him from here.
"Who are you?"
A well-wisher. We look after our feral brethren and those who would take care of them.\n\nKazu showed great caring towards one of us. We are merely repaying the favor.
